trans-unit.source: PlantUML Extension for Python-Markdown
trans-unit.target: PlantUML Extension for Python-Markdown

trans-unit.source: alt: text to show when image is not available. Defaults to uml diagram
trans-unit.target: alt : text to show when image is not available. Defaults to uml diagram

trans-unit.source: base_dir: path where to search for external diagrams files
trans-unit.target: base_dir : path where to search for external diagrams files

trans-unit.source: cachedir: directory for caching of diagrams. Defaults to '', no caching
trans-unit.target: cachedir : directory for caching of diagrams. Defaults to '' , no caching

trans-unit.source: classes: space separated list of classes for the generated image. Defaults to uml
trans-unit.target: classes : space separated list of classes for the generated image. Defaults to uml

trans-unit.source: format: format of image to generate (png, svg or txt). Defaults to png
trans-unit.target: format : format of image to generate ( png , svg or txt ). Defaults to png

trans-unit.source: png: HTML img tag with embedded png image
trans-unit.target: png : HTML img tag with embedded png image

trans-unit.source: priority: extension priority. Higher values means the extension is applied sooner than others. Defaults to 23
trans-unit.target: priority : extension priority. Higher values means the extension is applied sooner than others. Defaults to 23

trans-unit.source: server: PlantUML server url, for remote rendering. Defaults to '', use local command
trans-unit.target: server : PlantUML server url, for remote rendering. Defaults to '' , use local command

trans-unit.source: source parameter is used for inclusion of an external source diagram instead on an inline code. Here's an example in GitLab/GitHub block syntax.
trans-unit.target: source parameter is used for inclusion of an external source diagram instead on an inline code. Here's an example in GitLab/GitHub block syntax.

trans-unit.source: svg: HTML img tag with embedded svg image (links are not navigable)
trans-unit.target: svg : HTML img tag with embedded svg image (links are not navigable)

trans-unit.source: svg_inline: HTML5 svg tag with inline svg image source (links are navigable, can be manipulated with CSS rules)
trans-unit.target: svg_inline : HTML5 svg tag with inline svg image source (links are navigable, can be manipulated with CSS rules)

trans-unit.source: svg_object: HTML object tag with embedded svg image (links are navigable)
trans-unit.target: svg_object : HTML object tag with embedded svg image (links are navigable)

trans-unit.source: title: tooltip for the diagram
trans-unit.target: title : tooltip for the diagram

trans-unit.source: txt: plain text diagrams.
trans-unit.target: txt : plain text diagrams.

trans-unit.source: A PlantUML plugin for Markdown
trans-unit.target: A PlantUML plugin for Markdown

trans-unit.source: After installed, you can use this plugin by activating it in the markdown_py command. For example:
trans-unit.target: After installed, you can use this plugin by activating it in the markdown_py command. For example:

trans-unit.source: Before to run tests, install the required dependencies:
trans-unit.target: Before to run tests, install the required dependencies:

trans-unit.source: But before to use it, you need to configure which PlantUML binary to use: a local binary, or a remote server.
trans-unit.target: But before to use it, you need to configure which PlantUML binary to use: a local binary, or a remote server.

trans-unit.source: Example:
trans-unit.target: 예:

trans-unit.source: For Gentoo Linux there is an ebuild at http://gpo.zugaina.org/dev-util/plantuml/RDep: you can download the ebuild and the files subfolder or you can add the zugaina repository with layman (recommended).
trans-unit.target: For Gentoo Linux there is an ebuild at http://gpo.zugaina.org/dev-util/plantuml/RDep: you can download the ebuild and the files subfolder or you can add the zugaina repository with layman (recommended).

trans-unit.source: For markdown_py, simply write a YAML file with the configurations and use the -c option on the command line. See the Using a PlantUML server section for an example.
trans-unit.target: For markdown_py , simply write a YAML file with the configurations and use the -c option on the command line. See the Using a PlantUML server section for an example.

trans-unit.source: For passing options to the plantuml_plugin see the documentation of the tool you are using.
trans-unit.target: For passing options to the plantuml_plugin see the documentation of the tool you are using.

trans-unit.source: From version 2.0 a PlantUML server can be used for rendering diagrams. This speedups a lot the diagrams rendering but needs to send the diagram source to a server.
trans-unit.target: From version 2.0 a PlantUML server can be used for rendering diagrams. This speedups a lot the diagrams rendering but needs to send the diagram source to a server.

trans-unit.source: In either cases you need to specify the URL of the server in a configuration file like:
trans-unit.target: In either cases you need to specify the URL of the server in a configuration file like:

trans-unit.source: Installation
trans-unit.target: 설치

trans-unit.source: Make sure the plantuml.bat is on the path.
trans-unit.target: Make sure the plantuml.bat is on the path.

trans-unit.source: On Windows can be used the following plantuml.bat (many thanks to henn1001):
trans-unit.target: On Windows can be used the following plantuml.bat (many thanks to henn1001):

trans-unit.source: Options are optional (otherwise the wouldn't be options), but if present must be specified in the order format, classes, alt, title, width, height, and source. The option value may be enclosed in single or double quotes.
trans-unit.target: Options are optional (otherwise the wouldn't be options), but if present must be specified in the order format , classes , alt , title , width , height , and source . The option value may be enclosed in single or double quotes.

trans-unit.source: Plugin options
trans-unit.target: Plugin options

trans-unit.source: Running tests
trans-unit.target: 테스트 실행

trans-unit.source: Supported values for format parameter are:
trans-unit.target: Supported values for format parameter are:

trans-unit.source: Syntax:
trans-unit.target: Syntax:

trans-unit.source: The PLANTUML_JAVAOPTS variable can be used to set specific Java options, such as memory tuning options, or to set system variable used by PlantUML, such as then include search path. This would avoid modifications of the plantuml script. For example, with a diagram like:
trans-unit.target: The PLANTUML_JAVAOPTS variable can be used to set specific Java options, such as memory tuning options, or to set system variable used by PlantUML, such as then include search path. This would avoid modifications of the plantuml script. For example, with a diagram like:

trans-unit.source: The width and height options must include a CSS unit.
trans-unit.target: The width and height options must include a CSS unit.

trans-unit.source: The GitLab/GitHub block syntax is also recognized. Example:
trans-unit.target: The GitLab/GitHub block syntax is also recognized. Example:

trans-unit.source: The plugin has several configuration option:
trans-unit.target: The plugin has several configuration option:

trans-unit.source: The same thing can be done using the environment variable _JAVA_OPTIONS, which is readed by default by the java executable.
trans-unit.target: The same thing can be done using the environment variable _JAVA_OPTIONS , which is readed by default by the java executable.

trans-unit.source: The test execution requires a specific version of PlantUML (the image generated can be different with different PlantUML versions).
trans-unit.target: The test execution requires a specific version of PlantUML (the image generated can be different with different PlantUML versions).

trans-unit.source: Then you need to specify the configuration file on the command line:
trans-unit.target: Then you need to specify the configuration file on the command line:

trans-unit.source: This command uses a custom version of the plantuml command which will download the expected version of PlantUML for tests execution without clobbering the system.
trans-unit.target: This command uses a custom version of the plantuml command which will download the expected version of PlantUML for tests execution without clobbering the system.

trans-unit.source: This plugin implements a block extension which can be used to specify a PlantUML diagram which will be converted into an image and inserted in the document.
trans-unit.target: This plugin implements a block extension which can be used to specify a PlantUML diagram which will be converted into an image and inserted in the document.

trans-unit.source: To run the tests, execute the following command:
trans-unit.target: To run the tests, execute the following command:

trans-unit.source: To use the plugin with Python-Markdown you have these choices:
trans-unit.target: To use the plugin with Python-Markdown you have these choices:

trans-unit.source: Using a PlantUML server
trans-unit.target: Using a PlantUML server

trans-unit.source: Using a local PlantUML binary
trans-unit.target: Using a local PlantUML binary

trans-unit.source: You can download the war and deploy in a servlet container, or you can run it as a docker container.
trans-unit.target: You can download the war and deploy in a servlet container, or you can run it as a docker container.

trans-unit.source: You must export PYTHONPATH before running markdown_py, or you can put the definition in ~/.bashrc.
trans-unit.target: You must export PYTHONPATH before running markdown_py , or you can put the definition in ~/.bashrc .

trans-unit.source: You need to install PlantUML (see the site for details) and Graphviz 2.26.3 or later. The plugin expects a program plantuml in the classpath. If not installed by your package manager, you can create a shell script and place it somewhere in the classpath. For example, save te following into /usr/local/bin/plantuml (supposing PlantUML installed into /opt/plantuml):
trans-unit.target: You need to install PlantUML (see the site for details) and Graphviz 2.26.3 or later. The plugin expects a program plantuml in the classpath. If not installed by your package manager, you can create a shell script and place it somewhere in the classpath. For example, save te following into /usr/local/bin/plantuml (supposing PlantUML installed into /opt/plantuml ):

trans-unit.source: basic.puml
trans-unit.target: basic.puml

trans-unit.source: copy the file plantuml-markdown.py in the extensions folder of Python-Markdown. For example, for Python 2.7 you must do:
trans-unit.target: copy the file plantuml-markdown.py in the extensions folder of Python-Markdown. For example, for Python 2.7 you must do:

trans-unit.source: copy the file somewhere in your home. A good choice may be the user-site path, for example (bash syntax):
trans-unit.target: copy the file somewhere in your home. A good choice may be the user-site path, for example ( bash syntax):

trans-unit.source: index.md
trans-unit.target: index.md

trans-unit.source: on Windows you can use Chocolatey, a package manager for Windows: do a choco install plantuml and you are ready to work (this command will install all dependencies, Java and Graphviz included, see https://chocolatey.org/packages/plantuml for details)
trans-unit.target: on Windows you can use Chocolatey, a package manager for Windows: do a choco install plantuml and you are ready to work (this command will install all dependencies, Java and Graphviz included, see https://chocolatey.org/packages/plantuml for details)

trans-unit.source: with pip, do a simple pip install plantuml-markdown, and the plugin should be ready to be used
trans-unit.target: with pip , do a simple pip install plantuml-markdown , and the plugin should be ready to be used
